definition: variant of 挽[wan3]/to draw (a cart)/to lament the dead
to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover

sentences.english: The answer to the question, I think, gets at the very heart of the meaning of this elegy.
sentences.chinese: 问题的答案，在于这首挽歌的中心意义。

sentences.english: It was as if the Night sang dirges with clenched teeth.
sentences.chinese: 那仿佛是夜神正在那儿咬牙切齿地唱挽歌。

sentences.english: His lament colors most modern scientific inquiries as well.
sentences.chinese: 他的挽歌也影响了现代大多数的科学探索。

sentences.english: A poem or song composed especially as a lament for a deceased person.
sentences.chinese: 挽歌，挽诗专门为悼念某一死者所写的诗或歌。

sentences.english: The writer sings an elegy of concuss the spirit returns to bowel for fool's tragedy destiny.
sentences.chinese: 作者为傻子的悲剧命运唱了一曲荡气回肠的挽歌。

sentences.english: In all five elegies the construction of the verses follows an alphabetical arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 在所有五个挽歌建设的诗句如下一个字母安排。

sentences.english: The second chapter explores the relationship between Jia and Medieval Elegy.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，探讨笳与中古挽歌的关系。

sentences.english: So we have in the pastoral elegy a generic form that's highly predictable.
sentences.chinese: 因此田园挽歌的形式是很固定的。

sentences.english: Let the whirlwind mourn its requiem.
Radiohead is singing a dirge to the record industry.
sentences.chinese: 收音机头”乐队为唱片行业唱响了挽歌。

sentences.english: Their elegiac poems expressed their self-pity and were the products of the given time and society.
sentences.chinese: 文人挽歌诗往往带有自挽的性质，是特定时代的产物。

sentences.english: A light song overcomes me like a dirge.
sentences.chinese: 轻快的歌曲竟似挽歌使我压抑。

sentences.english: Dirges so melancholic that they would scorch you.
sentences.chinese: 挽歌非常忧沉，会将你灼伤。

sentences.english: This is similar to the elegy complex of the intellectuals during the Six Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 这与六朝文士对于生死大化的挽歌情结十分相似。

definition: sad melody/stirring strains/elegy/dirge/threnody/sing with solemn fervor
